DataElement.preferredDefinition: For female participant's only -- age (in years) at which participant started having menstrual periods.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: a record of a patient's medical background related to the periodic discharge of blood and tissue from the uterus used as a basis for comparison.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Property.preferredDefinition: Regularly recurring physiologic changes in the endometrium during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminating in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. The hormonal changes that lead up to a woman's having a period. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days.

Concepts.definition: The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/17/14 Reused by caBIG & DCP; kept Released jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: values for the age when an individual first started having menstrual periods.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed Conceptual Domain to the RELEASED Version of Assessments in preparation of OneData. 6/18/14 EDRN content retired.  VD reused by C3D; kept Released jc

ReferenceDocuments.name: Age of first menstrual period
ReferenceDocuments.description: Age of first menstrual period? (How old were you when you first started having menstrual periods?)

ReferenceDocuments.name: COMMENT2002500
ReferenceDocuments.description: Valid value 0-20, 99. Record the age (in years) at which female participant started having menstrual periods.
